sub_title: Conductor, Pianist, Composer, Music Director of Indonesia Youth Orchestra(IYO)
summary:
After having obtained the diploma in composition in Tokyo and then 7 prizes at Paris Conservatoire, Kanako Abe begins her career first as a pianist. Her recording of piano works by Toru Takemitsu was particulary welcomed by critics.
Since her debut as a conductor in 2003, she is regularly invited to conduct the contemporary works performed by the Ensemble L’Itinéraire, Ensemble Zellig, Venezia Biennnale Festival, Festival GMEM, Festival Contretempo in Villa Medici etc.
In 2005 she founded the french «Ensemble Multilatérale», a chamber orchestra for contemporary music where she has been music director until 2014.
She has already made more than 90 world premieres in close collaboration with several composers including Martin Matalon, Jonathan Harvey, Michaël Lévinas and Régis Campo. Her discography includes four CDs Régis Campo and a disc Colin Roche.
While attending to her aesthetic interest to different style of music, she conducts the Orchestre National d’Ile de France, Janacek Philharmonic Orchestra Ostrava, Orchestre National de Montpellier, Orchestre d’Auvergne, Orchestre National de Lorraine, Orchestre Philharmonic de Nice, Orchestre National de Lille, Amor Philharmonic Orchestra, Romanian National Radio Orchestra, Orchestra Nipponica.
Lover of opera art since her childhood, she began her activities in this area.She was an assistant conductor at the Opera National de Montpellier in 2008-2009, Théâtre du Châtelet, Rhin National Opéra, Zürich opernhaus.
Kanako Abe has worked with many conductors and stage directors as Fabio Luisi, Jerzy Semkow, Lawrence Foster, Enrique Mazzola, Alain Altinoglu, Friedemann Layer, Yutaka Sado, René Koering, Jean-Paul Scarpitta, Moshe Leiser.
In recent years, she gave concerts in France, Egypt, Italy, Spain, Korea and frequently in Japan.
She organized and conducted in 2011 and in 2012 at UNESCO, the charity concert for the victims of Earthquake and Tsunami in Tôhoku, sponsored by Japanese Embassy.
